Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.mco2_supermarketsimulator.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
GameController class, this is used for controlling the main bulk functionality of the simulator That includes user input, starting up the simulation, running it, and loading in textures Most importantly, it also draws the game objects such as the tiles and the player.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(javafx.scene.Scene scene, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, DisplayController displayController, ProductSearchController productSearchController, CheckoutController checkoutController, InventoryController inventoryController, String name, int age)
      This is the constructor of the game controller, its params should contain the majority. of what the game needs to run.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene node to attach other nodes to.
      gc - the canvas to draw on basically.
      displayController - the controller for the UI in regard to the display tiles.
      productSearchController - the controller for UI in regard to the product search.
      inventoryController - the controller for UI in regard to the inventory, to be activated via Spacebar.

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render()
      Draws every game asset except UI, such as the tiles and the player.
